Iuran BPJS Kesehatan Naik, Pemerintah Coba Perhatikan Keluhan Pasien Kelas III Ini!
01 Nov 2019, 13:54 by Satiran


Iuran BPJS Kesehatan Naik, Pemerintah Coba Perhatikan Keluhan Pasien Kelas III Ini!

KBRN, Takengon: Pemerintah menaikan iuran BPJS Kesehatan melalui Peraturan Presiden Nomor 75 Tahun 2019 tentang Perubahan Atas Peraturan Presiden Nomor 82 Tahun 2018 tentang Jaminan Kesehatan.
Pelayanan prima dan professional harus menjadi prioritas Pemerintah sebagai dampak dari kenaikan yang diberlakukan mulai Agustus 2019 maupun januari 2020 mendatang.
Warga Aceh Tengah Abdul Aziz mengaku selama ini pelayanan yang diberikan Pemerintah melalui Rumah Sakit yang ada di daerah Aceh Tengah dan Bener Meriah masih buruk.
Banyak pelayanan yang masih tebang pilih dan membedakan pelayanan antar satu masyarakat dengan masyarakat lainnya.
Hal itu, ungkapnya harus menjadi perhatian Pemerintah, akibat dampak dari kenaikan iuran BPJS Kesehatan yang diberlakukan.
“Ya fasilitas paling tidak harus lebih prima lagi, pelayanannya lebih berpihak kepada masyarakat kecil. Jangan lagi ada pelayanan yang tebang pilih. Kelas III itu enggak diperhatikan pelayanannya. Bahkan obatnya pun generic bukan yang paten,” ujar Abdul Aziz, Jumat (1/11/2019)
Diketahui Iuran BPJS Kesehatan naik. Untuk kategori peserta Pekerja Bukan Penerima Upah (PBPU) dan Bukan Pekerja (BP) yang berlaku mulai 1 Januari 2020 adalah, kelas III menjadi Rp 42.000, sebelumnya RP 25.000, kelas II menjadi Rp 110.000 dari sebelumnya Rp 51.000 dan kelas I menjadi Rp 160.000 dari sebelumnya Rp 80.000.

BPJS Health Contributions Go Up, The Government Trys to Pay Attention to These Class III Patients' Complaints!
Nov 1 2019, 13:54 by Satiran


BPJS Health Contributions Go Up, The Government Trys to Pay Attention to These Class III Patients' Complaints!

KBRN, Takengon: The government raised BPJS Health contributions through Presidential Regulation Number 75 Year 2019 concerning Amendment to Presidential Regulation Number 82 Year 2018 regarding Health Insurance.
Excellent and professional services must be a priority of the Government as a result of the increase in force from August 2019 and January 2020.
Residents of Central Aceh Abdul Aziz admitted that so far the services provided by the Government through hospitals in Central Aceh and Bener Meriah are still poor.
Many services are still selective and differentiate services between one community and another.
That, he said, had to be a concern of the Government, due to the impact of the increase in BPJS Health fees that were imposed.
"Yes, the facilities must at least be more excellent, the services are more pro-poor. No more selective logging services. Class III did not pay attention to the service. Even the generic medicine is not a patent, "Abdul Aziz said, Friday (11/01/2019)
It is known that BPJS contributions have risen. For the category of Non-Wage Worker (PBPU) and Non-Worker (BP) participants, which took effect on January 1, 2020, class III was IDR 42,000, previously IDR 25,000, class II was IDR 110,000 from IDR 51,000 and class I was IDR 160,000 from previously Rp. 80,000.
